page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY
page.content: The block is typical of much of Oxfordshire. Although close to the city of Oxford it presents as a rural area with the land divided between ten farms.Two villages are within the block, as is part of a third, and the block is under the administration of five civil parishes. The land is undulating and partially wooded, rising to a steep escarpment giving views over Otmoor. The block is bisected by the B4027 road which carries heavy traffic to the M40 motorway. The area is criss-crossed with public footpaths. The Oxfordshire Way,a long distance footpath ,passes through the area. The river Cherwell and its tributaries, the Ray and Bayswater Brook, drain the land. The area seems free of electricity power-lines and pylons.
